3: Screw you! You filthy 'heroes'!
Don't cry on the ground. Man up a little, will you? How's the potion collection going, Camu, Karenina?
Why are you the one giving orders?!
After learning that recovery potions could make the trip a lot easier, Vera started collecting them from every household.

4: Don't we already have more than enough?

3: Is that sympathy from you? I knew you were a doormat long ago...
It's the more the merrier when it comes to potions. Who knows what will happen next?
We didn't take anything other than recovery potions. No money, no weapon, nothing valuable at all. I say we are actually very good people.
No. We are no different from the bandits.
Bandits take things without paying, but Karenina left some money in every home. Well, we didn't know how much exactly we should pay, but at least we paid.
When did you notice?!
Oh Karenina, you can never be a bad guy.
I never wanted to!
Camu and Karenina soon returned with lots of recovery potions. Vera then divided them in half and put them into her own bag and Karenina's bag.
Good, now let's move to the next village.

4: Aren't we supposed to go for the Demon Generals?

3: Of course. I can heal, so I don't really need potions myself, but I just love taking things away from others.
The Demon General's Castle is just after the next village. Whether you like it or not, we will go through that village regardless.
You will not do anything you want, minions of the King!
I don't mind you calling us minions, but at least show some respect for your King.
Just when Vera was about to leave with the team, a few guard robots from the village stopped them, trying to take revenge on the team for justice.
The King is only interested in his weird experiments. He had done nothing except killing Demons!
Your country is such a mess... But that has nothing to do with me.
I only need to win. Out of my way!
Vera drew her weapon and charged toward the guards.
